Ação: Solicitar que os alunos gerem um mapa conceitual inicial sobre a mudança climática
Contexto: In the first lesson (engagement), students were first asked to generate a concept map to allow them express their initial understandings, and they also shared their ideas with class.

Contexto: In the first lesson (engagement), students were first asked to generate a concept map to allow them express their initial understandings, and they also shared their ideas with class.

Contexto: Then, students viewed an animation clip on climate change (see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6uMUJfYiM4).

Ação: Revisar o mapa conceitual após a animação
Contexto: Afterwards, students were allowed to modify their concept maps if they wish to do so.

Ação: Fazer previsões sobre sinais e fontes da mudança climática antes das visualizações
Contexto: Before examining each visualisation, students predicted the relevant issues concerning climate change, explored the visuals (see Figure 1), and then came up with an explanation in relation to signs and sources of climate change, changes in climatic zones, and the effect of greenhouse gases on climate change; in other words, they learned about the chemical mechanism of climate change due to the increasing amount of greenhouse gases.

Ação: Explorar visualizações e vídeo para identificar sinais e  zonas climáticas e gases de efeito estufa
Contexto: students explored the signs and sources of climate change, changes of climatic zones from the referred website (see Figure 1, and https://ilmasto-opas.fi/…) and the role of greenhouse gases on climate change from a video clip (see Figure 1, and https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HS0So6lOE-8).
Categorias: Protocolo definido pelo aluno / exploratória | Inferência / identificação de lacunas

Ação: Elaborar explicação inicial sobre os mecanismos da mudança climática
Contexto: Before examining each visualisation, students predicted the relevant issues concerning climate change, explored the visuals … and then came up with an explanation in relation to signs and sources of climate change, changes in climatic zones, and the effect of greenhouse gases on climate change…
Suporte Pedagógico: Discussão em grupo; feedback do professor

Ação: Planejar experimento controlado sobre a acidez oceânica
Contexto: students experimentally explored the effect of increasing acidity of oceans on sea life such that they identified the variables and designed a controlled experiment to examine the change in acid content of solution as the time passes.
Suporte Pedagógico: Materiais de laboratório; orientação para identificação de variáveis

Ação: Executar experimento medindo o pH de conchas em diferentes soluções
Contexto: students treated pieces of sea shells, which consist of calcium carbonate, with both water and hydrochloric acid solution in two different beakers and measured the change in acid content with a pH metre for each beaker at certain time periods.
Categorias: Laboratório físico | Coleta de evidências / dados quantitativos

Ação: Projetar experimento sobre o derretimento de gelo e o nível do mar
Contexto: Students identified the variables and designed a controlled experiment such that they put the equal volume of water in two equal sized beakers as well as including an equal sized and shaped rock in each one, and then they placed the equal pieces of ice in each one, but where the pieces of ice placed were different.
Suporte Pedagógico: Beakers; rocha; gelo; instruções de desenho experimental
Categorias: Protocolo definido pelo aluno / exploratória | Levantamento de hipóteses / predições

Ação: Observar o efeito do derretimento de gelo no nível da água
Contexto: students investigated the effect of climate change on sea level rising as sea ice and continental ice get melted.
Suporte Pedagógico: Medição do nível de água; instrumentos de observação
Categorias: Laboratório físico | Coleta de evidências / dados quantitativos

Ação: Calcular a própria pegada de carbono com aplicativo on‑line
Contexto: They calculated their own carbon footprint on the earth by utilising an online app (see https://www.carbonfootprint.com/calculator.aspx) and noticed how big it is compared to their predictions.
Suporte Pedagógico: Calculadora de pegada de carbono; dispositivo digital

Ação: Comparar o valor da pegada de carbono com as previsões iniciais

Ação: Negociar em papéis atribuídos a pertinência de um projeto rodoviário
Contexto: They were assigned roles such as a citizen, a politician, an environmental scientist, an environmental activist, an employer of a road construction company, and a climate scientist, and they were asked to negotiate if the road construction project should be started or stopped by offering convincing reasons.
Categorias: Roleplay | Colaboração estruturada | Discussão não mediada por tecnologia

Ação: Professor faz perguntas relacionadas a RRI para aprofundar o debate
Contexto: As students were sharing their arguments, they were asked specific questions about the aspects of RRI in order to help them connect the given context to the RRI aspects such as: ‘While you were generating your arguments … (Open access)’.
Categorias: Discussão não mediada por tecnologia | Atividade metacognitiva

Ação: Escrever entradas de diário reflexivo ao final de cada aula
Contexto: For the evaluation purpose, at the end of each lesson, students wrote down a journal entry by reflecting on their learning in a particular lesson.
Categorias: Lista de verificação / rubricas | Suporte scaffold

Ação: NPC Mark apresenta o problema do rádio aos alunos
Contexto: During the Problem Presentation Phase in the game scaffolding group, the NPC Mark presents the issue related to the train’s two-way radio to learners.
Suporte Pedagógico: Procedural scaffolding: NPC Mark via Google Form

Ação: Alunos recebem a missão e leem as instruções em PDF hospedado na nuvem
Contexto: Similar mission’s content and guidance are converted to a PDF file format (without NPC involvement) and uploaded to the cloud, accessible by both the document scaffolding groups and the no scaffolding groups.

Ação: Alunos exploram cenários e consultam o 'Maintenance Log' para coletar evidências iniciais
Contexto: At the Problem Definition Phase, learners in the game scaffolding group explore the game scenes by interacting with NPCs and referring to the ‘Maintenance Log’ to collect information related to the two-way radio malfunction as initial evidence for defining the cause.
Suporte Pedagógico: Cognitive e analytical scaffolding: NPCs + Maintenance Log (Jamboard)

Ação: Alunos formulam hipóteses sobre a causa da falha e registram no Google Form
Contexto: Learners in all three groups utilise the gathered information to formulate a hypothesis regarding the cause of the two-way radio malfunction. They then report and explain their hypothesis in the Google Form.
Suporte Pedagógico: Metacognitive scaffolding: prompts no Google Form

Ação: NPCs fornecem conhecimento conceitual sobre eletromagnetismo e o funcionamento do rádio
Contexto: Cognitive Scaffolding: Delivered by other NPCs in the game or in PDF format ..., primarily offering conceptual knowledge related to electromagnetism and information concerning the two-way radio issue to facilitate learners’ cognitive thinking.

Ação: Alunos realizam testes práticos no simulador de rádio a bordo do trem
Contexto: During the Investigation/Inspection Phase, learners in the game scaffolding group conduct practical tests on the two-way radio aboard the train.

Ação: Alunos trocam entre seis canais e coletam dados para validar a hipótese
Contexto: Using the radio simulator, learners can freely switch between six different frequency channels for testing (call out). They collect data from these tests to verify the validity of their hypothesis.
Categorias: Simulação / material interativo | Coleta de evidências / dados quantitativos

Ação: Professores disponibilizam 'Maintenance Log' e simulador como ferramentas analíticas
Contexto: The game utilises the ‘Maintenance Log’ and the train two-way radio simulator as tools to enhance learners’ analytical thinking.
Suporte Pedagógico: Analytical scaffolding: Maintenance Log e simulador
Categorias: Suporte painel de desempenho | Suporte scaffold

Ação: Alunos explicam os resultados da investigação no Google Form
Contexto: Subsequently, learners in all three groups are required to once again explain their investigation results using Google Forms.
Categorias: Discussão não mediada por tecnologia | Discussão aberta

Ação: Alunos refletem e ajustam suas hipóteses antes de submeter a solução
Contexto: Through this form, learners will be prompted to reflect on whether the cause of the two-way radio malfunction aligns with their initial hypothesis or differs from it, encouraging learners to make adjustments or refinements to their hypothesis before submitting a solution.

Ação: Professores oferecem feedback e debriefing automatizados após submissão
Contexto: This Google Form will offer timely feedback, providing an overall concept explanation and debriefing on their inquiry performance after submission.
Suporte Pedagógico: Procedural/metacognitive scaffolding: feedback no Google Form
Categorias: Suporte scaffold | Suporte painel de desempenho

Ação: Alunos discutem colaborativamente soluções e conclusões
Contexto: Players collaboratively discuss and propose conclusions and potential solutions for the malfunction.
Categorias: Discussão não mediada por tecnologia | Discussão aberta | Colaboração estruturada

Ação: Professores facilitam discussões em tempo real pelas plataformas online
Contexto: Both platforms facilitate real-time discussions throughout the activity, especially during the Hypothesis Formation and problem-solving phases.
Suporte Pedagógico: Peer scaffolding: facilitação via Gather Town/Google Meet
Categorias: Comunicação mediada por tecnologia | Discussão aberta
